txt.en: Listen to the words of Gandalf concerning his discoveries
'For twenty years after the Battle of Fornost, they sought to end the threat of Angmar forever.'
'This brought them to the Grey Mountains, where they met Vóin of the Zhélruka.'
Examine the indistinct figures
Listen to the words of Gandalf concerning his discoveries
Gandalf speaks to you of the discoveries he made while studying the Black Book.
'I should have known, [placeholder]. I should have read the signs.'
Vóin writes of his adventures in the Grey Mountains, where he encountered Magoldir the Elf and the two became fast friends.

'From my earlier study of the Black Book, we learned of Vóin's encounter with Magoldir the Elf in the Grey Mountains and their subsequent friendship. Unremarkable, perhaps, and yet we marked it, for an air of mystery surrounds this tome; both the circumstances in which it was found and the writing between its black covers fill me with intrigue and unease in equal measure.

'From the shade of Isildur we learned somewhat of Magoldir the Elf, and few of his deeds seemed notable. It is no slight to him, merely the truth that his most significant achievement appears to be his survival; nearly two thousand years passed before his name surfaced anywhere, and that in the Black Book.

'What, then, of Magoldir's inclusion? Why did Vóin see fit to write of this Elf?'
Gandalf has made a worrisome discovery while continuing his study of the Black Book of Mordor.
Gandalf is in the Grey Mountains as they are depicted by the Halls of Memory.
Talk to Gandalf

Move through the twisting passage until you reach the Grey Mountains, as depicted by the Halls of Memory
'What has Vóin to say about this meeting? Listen well, [placeholder].'
Gandalf is in the Grey Mountains as they are depicted by the Halls of Memory.
DNT - Blah!
Two thousand years following his survival of the Siege of Barad-dûr, Magoldir adventured in the Grey Mountains... but he did not travel alone.
DNT - Blah!
TBD
DNT - Blah!
'It is a dwarf.'
'I am called Magoldir. My boon companions and I mean you no harm.'
'That is true.'
Two thousand years following his survival of the Siege of Barad-dûr, Magoldir adventured in the Grey Mountains... but he did not travel alone.
'I think that is less true, Master Dwarf. We go where evil lurks, and oppose it.'
Two thousand years following his survival of the Siege of Barad-dûr, Magoldir adventured in the Grey Mountains... but he did not travel alone.
Gandalf flips through the pages of the Black Book
'Hold, strangers! Who goes there, and for what purpose?'
'You are an Elf.'
'The mountains are no place for an Elf.'
'We must return in these Halls of Memory to Vóin's account of the Grey Mountains.'
'Magoldir did not adventure alone.'
'I have learned the identities of the others in his band.'
'Consider them now, and I will share with you what I have learned.'
'They were knights of Gondor, adventuring far from home in the years after the Battle of Fornost.'
'They sought out pockets of Angmarim resistance in the mountains, and ended their threat.'
'These were their names.'
Gandalf is in the Grey Mountains as they are depicted by the Halls of Memory.
'Orolang.'
'Macilnis.'
'Yes, [placeholder].'
'With deception Vóin masks the name, but it is of Eärnur he writes.'
'The very same Eärnur who would become Mordirith, the False King of Angmar.'
'The same Eärnur who commanded the armies of Mordor in the guise of Gothmog.'
'He troubles us still, and makes his presence felt even in this tome from a thousand years ago.'
Examine the indistinct figure that remains
Listen to the words of Gandalf concerning his discoveries
'Calatúr.'
'And Silmahtar.'
'You know these names, [placeholder], as do I.'
'And you know the name of he to whom they pledged their loyalty.'
'Eärnur.'
Instance: The Picture Painted
'Before he became the king of Gondor, he was its prince.'
Talk to Gandalf in the Grey Mountains, as depicted by the Halls of Memory
'While his father Eärnil ruled from Minas Anor, he did the bidding of Gondor in the north.'
'Eärnur fought at Fornost with his knights, and it was there they met Magoldir.'
